SECRET.
G.T.5183
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 21st JULY, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
(a) French Front. Heavy fighting is still going on on the Western side of the CHATEAU THIERRY salient, where the Germans are putting up a desperate resistance to the French attacks.
At 7 o'clock last night the line was reported to be as follows:- East of BOURESCHES - MONTHIERS - East of SOMMELANS - LATILLY - GRANDMENIL (German) - midway between BILLY-SUR-OURCQ and OULCHY LA VILLE - LE PLESSIER HULEU - PARCY TIGNY - VILLEMONTOIRE - ACONIN - BERZY (German) MONTAGNE DE PARIS - MERCIN - South of COURTIL - FONTENOY. The total captures now reported on this battle front are 20,000 prisoners and 400 guns.
Between REIMS and CHATEAU THIERRY the French now hold the line of the MARNE as far as REUIL-SUR-MARNE. From REUIL to BOUILLY fierce fighting is taking place and strong enemy counter-attacks appear to have regained some of the ground taken yesterday by British troops.
The line runs approximately as follows :- ST EUPHRAISE - (French) - BOUILLY (German) - CUITRON - MARFAUX - BULLIN - NAPPES - LA NEUVILLE-AUX-LARRIS - LA CHARMOISE (German) BELVAL - SAVARTS FARM - REUILL.
(b) British Front. The general situation remains unchanged.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is nothing of special interest to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.l.
21st July, 1918.
Issued at 12.55 p.m.
